ontologyFramework.OFErrorManagement

Class OFDebugLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • ontologyFramework.OFErrorManagement.OFDebugLogger

  • public class OFDebugLogger
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to manage logging texts organized in base at the class which are generated them. To do so, it controls a table of message that are also ordered by time. This class is initialized during system starting up in relation with the ontological individual C_DebuggingConfig belong to the class Debugger which must have the following data properties: C_DebuggingConfig hasDebuggingPrintOnFile "/src/logs/log.txt"^^string C_DebuggingConfig hasDebuggingPrintOnCOnsole "true"^^boolean C_DebuggingConfig hasDebuggingOrderPrintRate "5"^^integer C_DebuggingConfig hasDebuggingRunGui "true"^^boolean Please, refer to the documentation of this class for more info about this features. Moreover, all the logs are attached to a boolean value to decide if notify or not particular logs. This can be reflacted into the ontology using an individual, belong to the ontological calss "DebuggedClass", to defined this boolean value. For example: C_OWLLibraryDebugger logsDebuggingData C_trueFlag where: C_trueFlag hasTypeBoolean "true"^^boolean In this case a logger can be created using: OFDebugLogger logger = new OFDebugLogger( OWLLibrary.class, DebuggingClassFlagData.getFlag( C_OWLLibraryDebugger));. Please refer to DebuggingClassFlagData.getFlag(String) for more info.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Buoncomapgni Luca

      OFDebugLogger(java.lang.Object toFollow, java.lang.String txt, boolean flagTofollow)
      It does the same work as OFDebugLogger(Object, String) but specify that all the logs given from this class must be notified or not.

        public static final java.lang.String DATAFORMAT

    • Constructor Detail

      • OFDebugLogger

        public OFDebugLogger(java.lang.Object toFollow)
        Defines a new logger attached to a particular class. As an example can be new OFDebugLogger(this) or new OFDebugLogger(StaticClass.class) for a generic static class.
        Parameters:
        toFollow - is the instance of the class from which will send this logs.

      • OFDebugLogger

        Parameters:

        txt - a first log.

      • OFDebugLogger

        public OFDebugLogger(java.lang.Object toFollow,
             java.lang.String txt,
             boolean flagTofollow)
        It does the same work as OFDebugLogger(Object, String) but specify that all the logs given from this class must be notified or not.
        Parameters:
        toFollow - the class which create logs.
        txt - a first log.
        flagTofollow - if it is true than the log are notified, no otherwise.

        toFollow - the class which create logs.
        flagTofollow - if it is true than the log are notified, no otherwise.

        public void addDebugStrign(java.lang.String text)
        Add a log to this logger. Basically it will call addDebugStrign( text, false);
        Parameters:
        text - a log

      • setFlagToFollow

        public void setFlagToFollow(boolean flag)
        Set if the log created by this logger must be notified or not.
        Parameters:
        flag - if it true than the log related to this logger will be notified, no otherwise.

      • getFlagToFollow

        public boolean getFlagToFollow()
        Returns:
        Return true if the logs produced by this logger are notified by this class, otherwise it will return false.

      • getFollowedClass

        public java.lang.Object getFollowedClass()
        Returns:
        The class that are producing this logs.

      • getNamedInstance

        public java.lang.String getNamedInstance()
        It manipulate the returning value of getFollowedClass() to retrieve its name of the instance to print. Basically if the name contains the symbol "@" than it will return the chars the follow it otherwise it will return all the name.
        Returns:
        the instance name from its class definition.

      • getNamedClass

        public java.lang.String getNamedClass()
        Returns:
        the getSimpleName() applied to the class given during class creation for this logger.

        Returns:
        all the logs for this logger.

      • getAllInstances

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,OFDebugLogger> getAllInstances()
        Returns:
        a map which contains all the created instances of this class related to a key equal to the result of getNamedClass().

      • printActiveIstances

        public static void printActiveIstances()
        print to console the map which is returning by getAllInstances().

      • getLogInfo

        public static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> getLogInfo()
        It goes across all the instance of this class and return a table with all the logs create by all the logger ordered by time. In particular, the column of this table are: time stamp, class name and textual log.
        Returns:
        a table with all the logs created by all the instances of this class.

      • getTableInfo

        public static java.lang.Object[][] getTableInfo()
        Returns:
        an object to be used as JTable manipolating the returning value of getLogInfo().

      • printLogOnConsole

        public static void printLogOnConsole(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> logData)
        Print on console all the logs info contained in the input parameter. It uses a parsing mechanism in accord with the table returned by: getLogInfo().
        Parameters:
        logData - all the long formatted as a table.

      • printLogOnFile

        public static void printLogOnFile(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> logData)
        Print on file all the logs info contained in the input parameter. It uses a parsing mechanism in accord with the table returned by: getLogInfo().
        Parameters:
        logData - all the long formatted as a table.

      • getPrintOnFile

        public static java.lang.String getPrintOnFile()
        Returns:
        the directory path to the file if this class is printing to file. If it is not printing this method will return: "none".

      • setPrintOnFile

        public static void setPrintOnFile(java.lang.String printOnFile)
        Set to print longs on file. This will not be done if the input parameter is equal to "none". Moreover it uses FileManager to use files and if the input parameter is equal to FileManager.DEFAULT_command than it will be initialized as: {#code new FileManager(FileManager.defaultComand, FileManager.defaultComand, FileManager.keyTxt);}. Otherwise it is possible to give, as input parameter a relative path to a file that should be augmented with available logs.
        Parameters:
        printOnFile - the directory path to the file or the instruction to do not print over file or the default file definition of FileManager.

      • getPrintOnConsole

        public static java.lang.Boolean getPrintOnConsole()
        Returns:
        true if the class is printing on console, false otherwise

      • setPrintOnConsole

        public static void setPrintOnConsole(java.lang.Boolean printOnConsole)
        Parameters:
        printOnConsole - the printOnConsole to set. If it is true than all the logs will be printed on console, if it is false no.

      • getOrderPrintingRate

        public static java.lang.Integer getOrderPrintingRate()
        A parameter as been introduced to find a correct trade off between ordering with respect to time logs without having a big list to manage before to print and than clean them.
        Returns:
        the number which defines after how many longs this class has to build the relate table, eventually notifing it and then clearing it.

      • setOrderPrintingRate

        public static void setOrderPrintingRate(java.lang.Integer orderPrintingRate)
        A parameter as been introduced to find a correct trade off between ordering with respect to time logs without having a big list to manage before to print and than clean them.
        Parameters:
        orderPrintingRate - set the number of logs that are saved in the table before to notify logs and clear the resources.

      • getStartGui

        public static java.lang.Boolean getStartGui()
        Returns:
        return true if the debugging GUI starts when the program starts.

      • setStartGui

        public static void setStartGui(java.lang.Boolean startGui)
        Parameters:
        startGui - set to true if the debugging GUI should start when the program start. No starting property otherwise.
